The necessary conditions for using the r s-value as an average measure of fitness are: no large genetic variation between individuals and populations, no density dependence, no resource limitation, and that the population is surveyed at the stable stage distribution. Genetic variation in P. aculeata is low in Australia [38]. Density-dependence and resource limitation were satisfied by site selection. The stable-stage distribution was tested and confirmed using a χ 2-test ( Table S2).
